title: Piers Morgan prepares to evacuate mansion as wildfire edges closer to LA home
text:

Piers Morgan is preparing to evacuate his mansion in Los Angeles as deadly wildfires continue to rage near the £4.2million property.

The 54-year-old presenter shared a screen grab of emergency alerts that had flashed up on his phone and said they were preparing to leave the property.

He captioned the post: “Yikes. Rather discomforting msgs to wake up to.. the Getty museum is just 3 miles away.

“These fires are horrific, hard to explain to people back home how big and savage they get here in California, and how fast the changing winds can take them in completely different directions.”

(Image: SplashNews.com)

The raging bushfires are currently closing in on some of Los Angeles’ most affluent neighbourhoods, leaving dozens of Hollywood stars fleeing in the middle of the night.

One of the neighbourhoods under alert is Brentwood, home to basketball superstar LeBron James, A-list Hollywood actors, wealthy producers and numerous media company executives.

LA Mayor Eric Garcetti announced he would sign an emergency declaration to draw more resources to fight the blaze, which began near the Getty Center arts complex before rapidly engulfing more than 500 acres of land.

(Image: Los Angeles Times via Getty Imag)

California's governor has declared a state-wide emergency as wildfires continue to rage across the northern areas of the state.

More than a million people have been left without power, with another million told to prepare for an outage.
